page.title: 14MAY DAY
page.content: May Day is celebrated each year by the Primary schoolchildren. Each child takes flowers to distribute to senior citizens in the village during the morning. At each pensioner's house the May Carol is sung. At Midday the children return home for lunch collecting the May Bread from the Vicar at Church. The playground is prepared with chairs and the Maypole. The children come back bringing entries for a garland competition judged by a celebrity. Everyone goes to Church for a May Day Service. Afterwards, the May Queen, chosen by the children a month earlier, is crowned on the Eleanor Cross flanked by her consort and attendants. The children proceed to the playground to present a programme of dances. Finally a May Day tea is served for the pupils in the Village Hall.
